channel.title: Correct 3-dimensional movement
channel.description:
I'm working on a basic cube game (not really a game, more a learning experience) in OpenGL (using the LWJGL) and I was hoping someone can help me get the movement correct. You can see my code here: http://pastebin.com/gaTtUkDn I have forwards and backwards movement working, yet when I rotate the cube I no longer walk "forwards". I know that this is not a bug, as it is what it's meant to do, but I was hoping someone could point me in the right direction :)
Thanks

item.title: Correct 3-dimensional movement
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

So, what you’re saying is that you want the cube to move on an angle when you turn it, right?

If so, when the player presses forward, you add a vector to your location with the following x and y:
(cos(cubeRot), sin(cubeRot))
For walking backwards, you take the same vector and multiply it by -1.
